definition: to brush/to paint/to daub/to paste up/to skip class (of students)/to fire from a job

sentences.english: And Russia is making up for past humiliations after the collapse of the USSR.
sentences.chinese: 俄羅斯在洗刷前蘇聯瓦解之後所蒙受的屈辱。

sentences.english: Excessive biological growth washes off the packing and is removed in a clarifier.
sentences.chinese: 多餘的生物生長將被洗刷掉，移入沉澱池。

sentences.english: Our housemaid does everything except wash the car.
sentences.chinese: 除了洗刷汽車之外，我們的女僕人什麼都做。

sentences.english: Wash off fruits and vegetables with cool running water.
sentences.chinese: “洗刷水果和蔬菜要用冷的自來水”。

sentences.english: Executing these war criminals 10,000 times would not atone for their sins.
sentences.chinese: 即使這些甲級戰犯死一萬遍也不能洗刷他們的罪惡。

sentences.english: Some evil, can not wash, can only be redeemed.
sentences.chinese: 有些罪惡，不能洗刷，只能補贖。

sentences.english: Then they'll start scrubbing the walls.
sentences.chinese: 然後他們就開始洗刷牆壁。

sentences.english: Two days after his arrival on Coruscant, Ghent had Ackbar cleared.
sentences.chinese: 根特抵達科洛桑兩天後，就爲阿克巴洗刷了罪名。

sentences.english: Make cleaning and cooking become meditation.
sentences.chinese: 使洗刷和做飯也變成沉思。

sentences.english: As I walk'd where the ripples continually wash you Paumanok.
sentences.chinese: 我不倦地行走去洗刷跑馬洛克的漣漪。

sentences.english: Brushing should be done once or twice a day, on rising before you dress and on retiring.
sentences.chinese: 洗刷需要一天一次或兩次，在你起牀穿衣前或就寢前。

sentences.english: Together the old man and the young boy washed the supper dishes.
sentences.chinese: 爺孫倆晚飯後一起洗刷盤子。

sentences.english: Yes, he agreed, but it hadn't absolved me from my sin.
sentences.chinese: 他說它並未因此而洗刷掉我的罪孽。

sentences.english: Help me to groom the horses for the show tonight.
sentences.chinese: 幫我把這些馬洗刷乾淨，好讓它們參加今晚的演出。

sentences.english: Republic, she was scrubbing a hundred years of humiliation.
sentences.chinese: 共和國，她洗刷了百年恥辱。

definition: to cleanse/to scrub/to scour/to wash down/to erode/to wash away
to erase/to wipe out (a previous humiliation etc)
to sweep/to clean with a brush/to sweep away (often fig.)
to clear away/to eliminate/to get rid of
muddy/covered in (mud, dust, sweat, blood etc)/daubed in
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
